title: Data Structure
text: metadata file, essence, contains following information variables corresponding data file: Variable name Field type Decimal positions Variable description Metadata stored FCA way straightforward process: metadata file description header can span across multiple lines Information variable stored single line, variable descriptions can span across multiple lines (inconsistent way) metadata files variable names preceded two asterisks (**). asterisks used denote multiple-occurrence columns first corresponds variable stores codes. Files multiple-occurrence columns end NOTE can span across multiple lines. Nevertheless, features metadata files come handy: Variable names single word (.e., variable names separated spaces) Field type either “Numeric” “Alphanum.” always placed variable name Decimal position single-digit integer always placed field type. features allow us use regular expressions process metadata files.

title: Data Structure
text: purposes parsing files create tidy data frames, metadata files classified following unique scenarios: Scenario 1: variables single-occurrence (.e., variable preceded two asterisks). scenario referred “single”. Scenario 2: set single-occurrence variables followed set multiple-occurrence variables. scenario referred “single_multiple”. Scenario 3: set single-occurrence variables followed set multiple-occurrence variables followed second set single-occurrence variables. scenario referred “single_multiple_single”. classification important corresponding data file different structure depending scenario.

title: Data Structure
text: general terms, processing workflow data files involves: Reading data Applying column names Performing pivot operations (necessary) Specific pivot operations depend scenario corresponding metadata file

title: Data Structure
text: simplest scenario. data data file already expected format, task apply column names specified metadata file.

title: Data Structure
text: case, data data file adhere “tidy” principles. multiple-occurrence columns repeated class within “code” variable. help clarify previous statement, consider data file following (mock) column names: ColumnA ColumnB Code1 Metric1_Code1 Metric2_Code1 Code2 Metric1_Code2 Metric2_Code2 corresponding metadata file likely list column names : ColumnA ColumnB Code Metric1 Metric2 creates mismatch number columns identified metadata file (5) number columns corresponding data file (8). properly apply column names data file, total number distinct codes Code column must determined. column names appropriately applied data file, complete data processing applying long wide pivots.

title: Data Structure
text: complex scenario, currently applicable one data file (RCR7). Unlike Scenario 2, additional set single-occurrence columns follow set multiple-occurrence columns. observation data file, row contains comma-separated values variables belong first set single-occurrence columns, followed row class ‘code’ variable comma-separated values multiple-occurrence variables, finally, row contains comma-separated values remaining single-occurrence columns. case, initial step reading data involves concatenating lines corresponding observation (using loops). data read, processing similar Scenario 2, except naming columns necessary consider repeating columns middle dataset. naming columns, processing Scenario 2. resulting dataset differs metadata file places single-occurrence columns beginning.

title: Database
text: order setup ODBC connection local machine PostgreSQL database, first download install psqlodbc driver https://www.postgresql.org/ftp/odbc/releases. recommend downloading latest version matches computer’s specifications (e.g., 64-bit operating systems, download file ends “-x64.zip”).

title: Database
text: Next, open ODBC Data Source Administrator application local PC searching “ODBC Data Sources” “Start” menu desktop search bar. “Drivers” tab, see multiple ODBC Drivers installed name starts “PostgreSQL…”.    Navigate back “User DSN” tab click “Add” button upper right-hand side ODBC Data Source.    pop-window, select appropriate PostgreSQL ANSI driver matches system specifications. users “PostgreSQL ANSI(x64)”. select “Finish”.    last screen, enter connection credentials provided Ketchbrook Analytics (Database, Server, Port, User Name, Password), set SSL Mode “require”. click “Save”.    now successfully established connection PC PostgreSQL cloud database hosted Ketchbrook Analytics.

title: Database
text: Excel workbook, navigate “Data” tab. Click “Get Data” button left-hand side ribbon, select “Sources”, “ODBC”.    pop-window, select “PostgreSQL” option matches name ODBC connection set Step 2. Optionally, can expand “Advanced Options” write custom SQL query database. However, users find simply clicking “OK” button moving Power Query interface preferred method querying database.    next screen, select database table query. Note curated metadata files also stored database (tables start “D_”). table selected, select “Load” immediately load entire table Excel workbook, “Transform Data” launch Power Query editor leverage suite ETL tools available Power Query interface.

title: Getting Started
text: can parse data downloaded .TXT files tidy R data frames using process_data(): can also use process_metadata_file() process_data_file() process single metadata data files, respectively. Note: process_data() tested development team Call Report data March 2020 present. Please let us know find issues processing data older 2020.
code: # Process data from March 2023 data_2023_03 <- process_data(dir = "path/to/some/folder")

title: Getting Started
text: FCA Call Report data changed time, making difficult perform analysis across multiple periods. ensure comparisons can made safely, compare_metadata() returns differences data structure (files, column names, column definitions) two sets FCA Call Report data.
code: # Download data from June 2023 download_data(   year = 2023,   month = 6,   dest = "path/to/some/other/folder" )  # Compare metadata files from March and June 2023 compare_metadata(   dir1 = "path/to/some/folder",   # where we downloaded the March 2023 data   dir2 = "path/to/some/other/folder" )

title: Getting Started
text: {fcall} contains following internal datasets: file_metadata contains short description file. remaining datasets represent series “lookup table” dictionaries mapping integer codes raw data plain-English descriptions associated metadata. datasets follow naming convention <file>__<column>, file name raw data file column name column associated metadata file dataset provides codes/definition mapping. example, RCB Call Report data includes column INV_CODE; RCB__INV_CODE internal dataset {fcall} provides mapping integer codes associated plain-English definitions . streamline data retrieval usage, dedicated function named get_codes_dict() also available. function allows users access code dictionaries dataset without needing remember specific column name dataset contains codes:
code: RCB__INV_CODE |> str() #> Classes 'tbl_df', 'tbl' and 'data.frame':    35 obs. of  2 variables: #>  $ code : int  10 15 17 25 29 35 40 41 60 52 ... #>  $ value: chr  "U.S. Treasury securities" "SBA securities" "Other U.S. Gov't securities and Agency(excluding MBS)" "Securities fully and unconditionally guaranteed by a GSE (excluding MBS and Farmer Mac securities)" ... # Get codes dictionary information for "RCB" data get_codes_dict("RCB") |> str() #> List of 2 #>  $ codes_dict   :Classes 'tbl_df', 'tbl' and 'data.frame':   35 obs. of  2 variables: #>   ..$ code : int [1:35] 10 15 17 25 29 35 40 41 60 52 ... #>   ..$ value: chr [1:35] "U.S. Treasury securities" "SBA securities" "Other U.S. Gov't securities and Agency(excluding MBS)" "Securities fully and unconditionally guaranteed by a GSE (excluding MBS and Farmer Mac securities)" ... #>  $ codes_varname: chr "INV_CODE"

title: Parse Farm Credit Administration Call Report Data into Tidy Data Frames
text: R package parsing Farm Credit Administration (“FCA”) Call Report data tidy R data frames.

title: Parse Farm Credit Administration Call Report Data into Tidy Data Frames
text: {fcall} can installed CRAN using install.packages("fcall"). Alternatively, can install development version GitHub using {pak} like :

title: Parse Farm Credit Administration Call Report Data into Tidy Data Frames
text: FCA publishes Call Report data quarterly basis https://www.fca.gov/bank-oversight/call-report-data--download. June 2025, data represents set 72 .TXT files. files represent 36 datasets. files prefixed “D_” contain metadata (column names, data types, etc.) associated file containing raw, header-less comma-separated data. example, file starts “D_INST” contains metadata file starts “INST_”. , datasets structured way makes data analysis difficult. cases, chose pivot data make analysis-friendly. See Metadata File Scenarios -depth discussion pivoting took place. package provides 3 utility functions: download_data() allows users programmatically download (unzip) data specific quarter process_data() parses data unzipped .TXT files list R data frames containing Call Report data file metadata compare_metadata() compares two sets Call Report data different quarters Check Getting Started vignette learn three core functions.

title: Parse Farm Credit Administration Call Report Data into Tidy Data Frames
text: Ketchbrook Analytics also created PostgreSQL database store historical FCA Call Report data traditional, relational schema aligns output data frame structure resulting running process_data(). database allows users execute SQL queries easily analyze Call Report data across multiple quarters. Please reach info@ketchbrookanalytics.com like access database.

title: Download data from FCA website — download_data
text: year (Integer) year Call Report (e.g., 2022) month (String) month Call Report (e.g., "March"); may also supply integer (e.g., 3) representing month numerically dest (String) path directory data downloaded (unzipped) files (Optional) Character vector, representing names files .zip archive downloaded; default NULL, meaning files downloaded quiet (Optional) Logical. Controls whether download progress messages displayed console. Defaults TRUE.

title: Download data from FCA website — download_data
text: Console message informing user data successfully downloaded (unzipped)

title: Download data from FCA website — download_data
text: FCA publishes Call Report data quarterly. .zip files typically named "YYYYMarch.zip", "YYYYJune.zip", "YYYYSeptember.zip" "YYYYDecember.zip" (YYYY represents 4-digit year). Therefore, valid values month argument limited c(3, 6, 9, 12), unless anomaly FCA's reporting/publishing. Check https://www.fca.gov/bank-oversight/call-report-data--download ensure data available quarter interested .

"single_multiple_single", reads file line line, collapses every (N_CODES + 2) lines, reads collapsed lines using read.table.
